title: UX-UI Design Intern
requirements:
Position Summary

As a member of the Host Work design team, we deliver engaging and delightful experiences in the form of mobile and desktop digital products. We work the full breadth of the design process, from discovery to development documentation at hand off. Our product offering is unique, bringing our workplaces up to the standards of the new digital landscape. Smart home feature users are comfortable interacting through our product to help control their workplace experience. Using emerging and established programs, we love showing just what the future of the workplace looks like.

Position Objectives

Iterative Design on Digital Navigation

Conduct Qualitative and Quantitative user research to discover and present insights on current user experience

Use rapid prototyping techniques to develop, validate, and iterate on hypothesis created based on the insights found during user research

Organize and present findings from the iterations to design, product, and engineering leadership

Using the existing design system, create high fidelity prototypes that elaborate on both macro and micro-interactions to help create a holistic experience for users

Prepare thoughtful documentation on the designed experience to assist in the smooth transition from the design team to our engineering partners

Collaborate with engineering partners to test and QA the experience, ensuring any questions are met with a shared understanding of the ideal solution

These tasks will take place over the course of the 10-week program, culminating in a fully delivered product feature.

Organizational Structure

The UI/UX Design Intern will be reporting to the UI/UX Design Lead, under the UX Design Center of Excellence. In addition, there is immense collaboration between the Design, Product Management, and Engineering teams.

Situational Needs and Challenges

Host Work is a young product, recently positioned a unique value proposition inside the world’s largest commercial real estate services company. We are agile, collaborative, and driven to bring exciting digital solutions to our clients and their employees. Because we are a young product, there is a set of unique and exciting challenges to solve as part of the design team.

Technological Needs and Challenges

Because our product is young, we need to be agile and quickly adapt to market changes. This means pivoting on a moment’s notice, and delivering fast, sometimes forgoing some of the typical design process. We use these opportunities to help flex our design system’s muscle and adapt to the needs as they arise.

Team Structure Needs and Challenges

Our team is spread across two continents with both on-and-offshore teams working concurrently to deliver award winning solutions. In addition to the usual challenges, we have become remote during the COVID-19 Pandemic, though there are plans to return to in-person collaboration down the line. Host Work mostly has its sea legs under us in terms of digital collaboration but starting a new position fully remote can be a challenge.

Basic Requirements

Passionate about design and takes the initiative to learn independently and proactively contribute to the success of the team

A project that demonstrates their understanding of the design process

Intellectual curiosity and analytical skills in broad areas relating to user experience, technology, and design

Demonstrated understanding of visual design on mobile platforms

Understanding of user-centered design principles and the ability to execute upon them

Solid understanding of data driven design activities, such as storyboarding and experience models, ability to use these strategies to create high quality designs

Outstanding verbal and written communication, interpersonal and leadership skills are required.

Should be comfortable working in a very dynamic and collaborative work environment

Ability to create mock-ups and produce multiple iterations efficiently

title: UI/UX Intern - Boston
requirements:
Company Introduction

PartRunner is the go-to on-demand delivery service for the construction & trades industries. We are a team of experts in logistics, operations and in the industries of Plumbing, HVAC, Electric and Construction. We add value by reducing the time it takes for businesses to move parts/equipment.Overview:

What We Do

PartRunner is a New England-based startup that is revolutionizing how logistics are done for businesses. Called the \Uber for construction materials\ we focus primarily in the Trades, Construction, industries but we also work with Auto and Healthcare distributors.

We are a B2B last-mile service and leverage a network of independent drivers that have all types of vehicles; from cars, to cargo vans and 24ft box trucks. Our platform allows companies to connect to hundreds of truckers via our web, mobile, and api integrations.

Position Overview

We are looking for a talented UX Designer with a portfolio demonstrating the art of design and a track record of results. Your demonstrated skill-set must range from UX Design, flows and interactions, screen/page architecture in both Web and Mobile applications. You should have experience working directly with Product Managers to prioritize, specify, and delivering compelling user experiences.

Responsibilities
Work on general Front-End Design for Website
Design Marketing Materials (which may include: banners, flyers, brochures, and other promotional material)
Be familiar with user experience design, product management, engineering, and agile development environments and can turn complex use cases into intuitive and shippable product experiences.

Skills
CSS, HTML, Photoshop, In-Design, Sketch, In Vision, Adobe or any other design tool.

Qualifications
6 months-1 year minimum experience in similar position
Entrepreneurial minded and self-driven
Organized and adaptable
Multi-tasking
Team Player

title: Summer 2021 Internships: UX/UI Design Research Intern
requirements:
Description

Want to spend your summer interning at a company that is consistently rated as one of the best places to work in the country? Is this a rhetorical question??

The Motley Fool is a multimedia financial services company that provides financial solutions for investors through various stock, investing, and personal finance services. We've been on the block for about 26 years and have honed a reputation for producing industry-leading work in a nationally recognized workplace. Our mission is to help the world become happier, smarter, and richer and the backbone supporting this global mission is our top-notch tech team. If you dream of becoming a brilliant and skilled web designer and are ready to work hard on cutting edge technologies alongside awesome coworkers, then step up to the plate, and tell us why you should land a spot among our Foolish ranks.

For eight Foolish weeks as a UX/UI Design Research Intern, you'll be embedded with the Design and Web Technologies teams that support, build, and maintain our Foolish products and websites. You will have hands-on experience working with users and internal teams to investigate existing user mental models and design products that sustainably address our end users' needs. You will gain exposure to the entire UX Design process -- from the initial research to design, design testing, as well as the hand off to development! You'll also collaboratively shape what success looks like for the changes you propose. The projects you could work on may be team-level or span our entire tech organization.

You'll be challenged and mentored by some of our greatest designers all summer, and in turn, you'll develop the skills it takes to cultivate a user first mindset that will set you apart from your peers. We're excited to open our doors for Summer 2021 Design Intern applicants, so send us your most Foolishly written cover letter and your ultra-impressive resume. We're prepared to be wowed!

What You Need To Succeed
Excellent problem-solving skills with the ability to analyze situations, identify existing or potential opportunities, and recommend solutions.
Ability to present complex qualitative and quantitative data to diverse audiences in an understandable format via excellent verbal and written and/or visual communication skills.
Flexibility and ability to learn quickly.
Extraordinary critical thinking skills.
High-performing problem solving and collaborative skills.
Ability to communicate clearly and demonstrate emotional intelligence.
Ability to think quickly, resolve problems, and multi-task across numerous projects and teams.
Ability to keep a calm and pleasant demeanor under tight, evolving, and sometimes unpredictable timeframes and priorities.
Ability to translate insights into workable prototypes for testing and future iteration.

What would be really cool of you to have, but not required:
Experience applying qualitative research methods.
Experience with full-life cycle research and inspection methods which occur from ethnography all the way to statistically-based user testing.
Experience working on enterprise-level experiences that span multiple channels such as web, mobile, and offline interactions.
Experience with quantitative, behavioral analysis, and statistical concepts.
Experience managing digital product analytics with tools such as Google Analytics, Tableau, Airtable, or Spaghetti and Meatballs.
Experience using design methods and user research data to influence business strategy and leadership.
Familiarity with basic concepts of investing and finance.

title: Product Design Intern - Summer 2021
requirements:
Are you a web designer with a passion for intuitive UX and beautiful, simple design?

Do you have a "less is more" design philosophy and believe that the highest form of art is simplicity? (so do we!)

Are you looking to kick start a career in product design at a values-driven tech startup?

At Paradox, we believe when you get the people thing right you can build teams that can change the world. We’re a high performance culture with laser focus on building world class products and a team that our clients love. Our flagship product, Olivia, is the AI assistant helping companies around the world reimagine the way they hire: conversations instead of job applications, automatic interview scheduling, and so much more.

Recently named one of Forbes’ Top 500 Startup Employers, we’re looking for top performers who have a track record of success and want to build a company together as we continue our triple-digit growth.

We’re a company that believes software should be so simple it feels like magic. Our recruiting products are used by job seekers and hiring teams around the world and we’re looking for a UI designer who wants to help bring great design and delightful UX to the long-neglected world of HR technology. As a member of our Product team, you’ll work closely with engineers and PMs to design and ship simple, beautiful software that our clients and users love.

Sound like your dream job? We want to hear from you!

As a Product Design Intern, You Will
Design simple, intuitive web and mobile interfaces, translating business requirements into magical user experiences across the portfolio of Paradox products
Partner with Product and Engineering teams on end-to-end UI design initiatives, from conceptualizing and prototyping to building & shipping software
Create mockups, wireframes, prototypes, and user flows to showcase your user interface proposals and UX ideas
Participate in a highly collaborative, iterative design process, proactively giving and receiving feedback from team members
Uphold our high product standards and design philosophy
Continuously research and apply the latest UX/UI standards and industry trends

Experience & Skills Required
Pursuing a Bachelor’s degree in UI/UX design, graphic design, human computer interaction or related field (rising seniors preferred)
Experience in web and mobile user interface (UI) design - and a spectacular portfolio to show for it!
Excellent understanding of UX design principles and research methodologies
Familiarity with prototyping software such as Sketch, Framer, InVision, Figma, or Balsamiq
Openness to constructive design feedback
Ability to work independently and manage multiple projects simultaneously
Available to work May-August 2021 from our Scottsdale, AZ headquarters (40 hrs/week)
Authorization to work in the United States

Why You Should Work At Paradox
Work side by side with passionate, purposeful people - Talent is our DNA and we pride ourselves on having the best!
Ability to make a big impact on a growing organization and drive your own growth
The opportunity to build the next big thing in recruiting technology
Internal and external professional development, coaching, and continuous education opportunities

title: Summer Intern: UI/UX Design
requirements:
About G2

G2 is revolutionizing the way businesses discover, buy and manage software and services. More than five million users per month rely on G2 to help them find and buy the best software for their businesses. G2 features over 1 million authentic customer reviews, has built a global team of nearly 400 talented, motivated professionals, and has raised $100M in total funding from some of the world’s leading investors including IVP, Accel Partners, LinkedIn, Emergence Capital, Pritzker Group, Chicago Ventures, Hyde Park Ventures, industry leaders and its founders.

About The Role

As a member of G2’s Summer Internship Program, you will have the opportunity to join an exciting team, complete a variety of projects, and participate in professional development events. You’ll work closely with an Intern Mentor who will support you throughout the Program. As a member of design team you’ll have 3 main projects:

UX RESEARCH: You’ll work closely with other designers to do continuous discovery. Continuous discovery is a collaborative process in which UX designers facilitate user interviews continuously to uncover opportunities to improve our interface. It also involves working with designers and engineers to map, prioritize, and ideate on those opportunities, as well as provide recommendations.
PORTFOLIO PIECE: Working on a design project from start to finish. You’ll gather and analyze user data, create low and high fidelity wireframes, do usability testing, and use other UX methodologies to meet project goals.
DESIGN OPS: Work with designers to improve the operation of our team, including UX documentation, processes, design system maintenance, brainstorming sessions, and more.
This internship is remote (US only), and will be held from June to August. Interns will work 40 hours per week.

Requirements

We realize applying for jobs can feel daunting at times. Even if you don’t check all the boxes in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. Our global team comes from a wide range of backgrounds and experiences, and that’s what makes our G2 community strong and vibrant.
Pursuing a Bachelor's degree related to UX Design, UX Research, Human-Centered Design, Anthropology, Sociology, or a comparable field
A rising Senior at an accredited college or university
Experience with user research theory and methods
Ability to create interactive prototypes based on existing user journeys
Familiar with current interaction design concepts, and good understanding of design systems
Experience using Sketch, Adobe XD, Figma, or similar software
An inquisitive mind
A passion for every component of the user experience
Attention to detail and concern for accuracy.
Strong time management skills
Excellent organization skills (email, task management, follow-up)
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Self-motivated and able to work collaboratively and independently, delivering on assigned tasks and responsibilities.


About The Design Team

The design team at G2 is committed to providing our users and customers with intuitive experiences. We strive to design, test, and iterate on our products, as well as discover new opportunities to improve our platform. On our design team you will work with UI/UX professionals as well as business owners to drive strategy and direction to deliver a marketplace vision. Additionally, you will work with product managers, marketers, and engineers to drive the planning, testing and delivery of new features, executing on the product roadmap.

Why we love G2
G2 was founded to create a place where people will love to work. We strive to create meaning in work and provide more than just a job: a true calling. G2 is a place where people can be authentic and grow, find meaning and passion in work, and be motivated to succeed by a supportive group of coworkers. We pride ourselves on creating an environment where people can enjoy coming to work every day, by supporting our employees in their professional and personal lives.

title: Intern - UX Designer
requirements:
Job Description

We are hiring multiple enterprise Software Engineer Interns. This position combines the best features of both a start-up and an established corporation. You’ll be working with a small team in a fast-paced environment to develop new Smart Grid application software. You won’t get lost in a crowd. Your skills will be seen and appreciated!

The ideal candidate for the UI/UX design intern position is ready to bring their skills to a driven team that is working on ground breaking technology. The UI/UX design intern will research, design and iterate upon designs for multiple desktop, web and mobile applications.

If you are passionate about design and innovative technologies, we are looking for you!

Learn more about S&C's Product Innovation Team here: https://youtu.be/qVrfxa4JM0A

What Needs To Be Done

Design a desktop and web application for controlling and monitoring assets
Create user personas that will be used to guide the design process
Conduct market research to better understand the users’ needs and expectations
Define user flows
Follow best practices and work in an Agile environment
Have a proactive approach to improving the application with every sprint
Work with software engineers to implement an intuitive user experience
Work with team members to coordinate the development of new features
Understand the overall application feature set and goals
Work with software development team members to design and distribute assets for an android application
Support design needs of the software development team
Assist in the documentation process
Create and design end-of-program presentation to be given to management
Organize and catalog all assets for the application
Participate in the brainstorming and creation of design concepts

To select this job as one of interest to you, at a minimum, you must have the following:

Must be a student in good standing at an accredited university pursuing a degree in Computer Science, Graphic/Visual Design or a related field and returning to school full-time at the end of the internship.
Minimum of 1 year of hands on experience with UI and UX design.
Experience with designing vector graphics, icon creation/management, graphic design software (ie. Photoshop, Sketch, etc.), design for either web or mobile based applications.
Strong layout/typography skills and understanding of visual hierarchy and its importance in UI/UX design.
Excellent written and oral communication skills and organizational skills.
Good understanding of color theory.
User interface and use centered design skills.

Major Physical Demands

Standing: Occasional standing for work
Lifting: Occasional lifting of controls and test equipment, less than 50 pounds
Walking: Occasional walking throughout the facility
Carrying: Occasional carrying of light objects
Pushing: Infrequent pushing of objects, possibly related to rearrangement work
Pulling: Infrequent pulling of objects, possibly related to rearrangement work
Bending: Occasional bending during access to equipment
Reaching: Infrequent reaching
Handling: Frequent handling of parts or tools
Environment: Standard office / desktop workspace

title: UX Design Intern
requirements:
We heard you knock!
At Masonite, we make doors that do more. Our Purpose is We help people walk through walls , and by doing this we open new doors of opportunity for customers, partners and employees.

Six Cultural Pillars represent our organization’s culture and the behaviors employees demonstrate:
Integrity Under Pressure
People Are Key
Hold the Door Open
Flexibility in Every Fiber
Results Hinge on Accountability
On the Threshold of What’s Next

Design at Masonite has been growing steadily in reach and impact across the company—from the design of systems to hardware nuts & bolts, equipment & devices to digital experience, logistics & manufacturing process to environmental impact, from physical retail to e-commerce and more—all while creating and cultivating experiences that touch Masonite customers everywhere, every day. Masonite design teams include every flavor of the design discipline, including UX, UI, visual, industrial, interaction, illustration, animation, brand, and marketing design roles—as well as design technologists, ethnographic researchers, UX writers, and more. Check out masonite.design, to learn more and come build the future with us.

As a UX Design Intern, you will collaborate with a team that defines and designs user experience across products and services and input into the design of experiences, interfaces, systems, as well as user interaction, visual, and communication/engagement design.

Responsibilities
Design thoughtful, beautiful, and useful product and service experiences in a team environment
Create user-centered designs by considering market analysis, customer feedback, business metrics, and usability insights
Use business requirements, along with user and market research to assist in developing scenarios, use cases, and high-level requirements
Develop conceptual user experience journey maps
Develop conceptual wireframes, visual mockups, and prototypes
Work with stakeholders to plan projects for effective delivery while maintaining high standards for design
Be a passionate and effective advocate for design with non-design audiences


Essential Qualifications
Six-month internship and/or project experience in design
Experience working in a collaborative team environment to deliver high-quality design solutions
Experience in a variety of design and prototyping tools

Desired Qualifications
Experience with consumer brand experience design and an understanding of storytelling
Visual design expertise demonstrated through mockups and style guides
Additional design skills in related fields, including filmmaking, animation, motion design, and prototyping
Ability to extract complex concepts and quickly turn around detailed flows and mock-ups reflecting a range of options
Ability to proficiently present design solutions to stakeholders in design, engineering and product management
Ability to drive the design review cycle and close on design requirements independently
Able to use best practices for mobile and web-based information architecture and design, as well as knowledge of usability principles and techniques
Excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills
A portfolio demonstrating past work experience and school projects

Education
Pursuing a bachelor’s degree in computer science, human-centered interaction, design, statistics, psychology, human studies or a related field
Juniors and Senior level students. Seniors should have at least a semester or a quarter left out of their studies
Open to extraordinary!

title: UI/UX Intern
requirements:
About Treatspace

Treatspace is a SaaS-based healthcare platform that is disrupting and improving every day, critical healthcare processes that no longer work in a rapidly changing regulatory and reimbursement landscape. Our innovations help practices solve patient access and acquisition challenges. Treatspace received the Global Action Challenge Award in Nashville, Tennessee in 2015, competing against hundreds of other healthcare companies nationally and is one of the Top 5 Startups named by the Pittsburgh Technology Council Tech 50 Awards. We have also raised several million dollars of venture capital fund

How you will contribute:

You will be working closely with the engineering and product development team to own the product design lifecycle from end to end. You will begin by gaining a deep understanding of our users through research and behavior analysis. As a fast-growing company, we are constantly building new products, features, and tools that require forward-thinking designers to help us remain industry leaders. You will work to create wireframes, beautiful icons, and layouts for desktop and mobile responsive sites.

Skills you’ll bring:
Experience or interest designing and shipping web-based products and interfaces
Strong experience working from flows and wireframes through to the final product
UX and UI experience
Experience working with a SaaS product
Designing wireframes and mock-ups of new features
Collaborating with team members during design reviews to refine the user experience
Working with software engineers to ensure consistency between design and implementation.
Propose solutions to solve design/user experience challenges
Writing clean, concise and descriptive documentation of your features
Why you're important to us:

This role will impact our organization by creating beautiful designs for our products while continually improving our overall aesthetic. You will work in a fast-paced environment where continuous innovation is the bar and high attention to detail is a must have. The ability to manage multiple, competing priorities simultaneously will be the key to success in this role.

What You'll Need:
Currently enrolled in or recently graduated from a Bachelor's Degree
Knowledge of UI/UX best practices and trends
Portfolio of UI/UX related work
Powered by JazzHR

title: Virtual UX/UI Visual Design Intern
requirements:
Siemens Digital Industries Software, Electronic Board Systems

Virtual UX/UI Visual Design Intern

The Electronic Board Systems (EBS) unit delivers solutions for electronic systems design and simulation used by global companies in addressing their challenges of increasing product, process, and organizational complexity as electronics content is expanding everywhere. EBS is embarking on its next generation UX initiative and is seeking interns to assist in near term project milestones. For the qualified candidate, this is a great opportunity to gain real world experience in developing her/his future career prospects.

Responsibilities
Create UI elements and illustrations that simplify complex concepts into user-friendly and engaging visualizations and experiences for Desktop Enterprise level software (most important)
Recreate visuals/illustrations from existing designs
Familiar with current interaction design concepts, and good understanding of design systems
Work closely alongside a UX Designer to test proposed designs at concept, medium, and high fidelity/prototype phases
Support the build interactive prototypes


Must-Have Qualifications:
Currently pursuing a bachelor's degree in one or more of the following fields: Visual Communication, Interaction Design, Human Factors Engineering, Graphic Design, UX Design, UI Design, Product Design.
Available design portfolio (e.g., study plans, reports, personas)
Familiarity with human-centric approach to designing products
Strong cross-functional collaboration and communication skills
Fluency in contemporary design
Enthusiastic and eager to learn
Knowledge of one or more of the following Adobe Illustrator (Preferred), Adobe XD (Preferred), Adobe Photoshop, Sketch, Figma, Zeplin, Motion design / animation a plus


Organization: Digital Industries

Company: Siemens Industry Software Inc.

Experience Level: Student (Not Yet Graduated)

Job Type: Full-time

title: UX/UI Intern
requirements:
We are looking for a talented and motivated UX intern to join our team and build extraordinary products for our customers! We would love to have someone who is self-motivated and passionate about product design. You will work closely with one line of business and will have the support of a strong, active and co-located design team, as well as close collaboration with product owners and developers.

This is an active internship that will result in many portfolio pieces and significant real world experience. This is a great opportunity to challenge yourself and have a strong impact on the experience of several products, as well as consuming and contributing to a design system.

What will you be responsible for throughout the summer?
Manage well defined projects that you will own from start to finish.
Work closely with other UX designers, product owners and developers to create intuitive product experiences
Contribute to a central design system that other designers will use your work in the future
Participate in user research and usability testing
Participate in design thinking workshops with the Sovos design team
Drive the team mission of "Make Tax Intuitive" forward by making the complex, easy
And much, much more!


Desired Skills And Experiences
Interest in pursuing a career in UX/UI
You are passionate about good design, likely follow other designers and tend to notice good design in the products you use every day
An excellent portfolio demonstrating a high attention to detail, a keen sense of design and the ability to translate complex requirements into simple, intuitive experiences.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Strong follow through and ability to see projects to completion
Great team player

Build your future with Sovos.

Digital technology has forever changed business. Now, it’s transforming tax. Sovos’ software was built for the digital future of tax, with complete, connected offerings for tax determination, continuous transaction control compliance, tax reporting and more.

Sovos supports more than 8,000 customers, including half of the Fortune 500, operating in over 70 countries. Our SaaS products and proprietary Sovos S1 Platform integrate with a wide variety of business applications and government compliance processes.

Our 1,700 employees throughout the Americas and Europe are building the future of global compliance software with a culture of commitment to keep our promise to customers.

title: UX/UI Design Intern
requirements:
We’re looking for a talented UI/UX Design Intern to create amazing user experiences for web and mobile platforms. The ideal candidate should have the ability to create polished designs, possess superior UX skills and ability to translate high-level requirements into intuitive and functional user interfaces. This person needs to be an excellent multi-tasker, be able to work under pressure and independently, and effectively communicate with internal and external clients.

What You'll Be Doing
Work closely with design leadership to help define, develop, and maintain design systems
Collaborate with product management and engineering to define and implement innovative solutions for the product direction, visuals, and experience
Execute all visual design stages from concept to final hand-off to engineering
Conceptualize original ideas that bring simplicity and user friendliness to complex design roadmaps
Create wireframes, storyboards, user flows, process flows and site maps to effectively communication interaction and design ideas
Present designs and key milestone deliverables to peers and executive level stakeholders

What You'll Need
Bachelor’s degree obtained or in the process of being obtained in user experience design (UX/UI), web design & development, human factors design or related field
Portfolio showing both Web and Mobile experience, with examples including specific contributions in the design direction and decisions
Strong skills with branding, graphic design, user testing, writing for the web, and data visualization
Knowledge of front-end development frameworks (e.g. Bootstrap, HTML, CSS, JavaScript)
Knowledge of wireframing and rapid prototyping tools (e.g. Sketch, Figma and InVision)
Intermediate level skills in Adobe Creative Cloud (XD, Illustrator, Photoshop and InDesign)
Ability to work independently, as well as collaboratively and meet aggressive deadlines
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment developing solutions for mobile apps, web interfaces, and asset creation

Bonus Points
Familiar with design methodologies and leveraging human centered design or data insights to drive design decisions
Experience with working in an Agile development environment using Atlassian tools (e.g. Confluence & Jira)
Knowledge of Apple’s Human Interface Guidelines and the Material Design framework

Company Benefits

Our work environment is energetic, focused, fun, and collaborative. We’ve created a special culture where trust and transparency are the key and employees are empowered to make their own decisions. Our people are passionate about what we do and have an indomitable spirit to get things done. Everyone is a part of the big picture here.

First Orion has been voted a Great Place to Work with top rankings in every category! Learn more about what our employees have to say on our First Orion Glassdoor page!

At this time, we are not able to sponsor visas, such as H-1B, for this particular position, UI/UX Design Intern. First Orion is interested in every qualified candidate who is eligible to work in the United States. First Orion’s immigration sponsorship policy is applied in a nondiscriminatory fashion regardless of race, gender, ethnic origin, or any other classification protected by law. First Orion is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer.

About Us

First Orion helps the world’s leading carriers, enterprises and mobile apps provide mobile users with the protection they need from scams and the identity verification they need to answer trusted calls. The company’s flagship First Orion Call Protection Suite currently provides call control, blocking, transparency and management solutions to tens of millions of mobile handsets.

Additionally, First Orion’s Call Enhancement Suite, INFORM™ and ENGAGE®, tells mobile subscribers who is calling and why, empowering them with the ability to take action, while also providing businesses the ability to verify their identity when calling their customers. Nearly 87 percent of calls go unanswered because consumers don’t recognize the number or don’t trust the identity. With First Orion – enterprises, hospitals, government entities, non-profits, last-mile logistics, banks and more can now deliver critical communications and have their calls answered.

Processing over 90 billion calls annually, First Orion powers communication transparency solutions for T-Mobile, Metro by T-Mobile, Boost Mobile, Sky, Virgin Mobile and Sprint Prepaid mobile networks along with PrivacyStar and other mobile apps. Established in 2008 and led by Charles Morgan (former Founder & CEO of Acxiom), First Orion is headquartered in North Little Rock, Arkansas, has offices in Seattle, London, and Dubai, and employs more than 250 people globally.

More at www.firstorion.com , @FirstOrionCorp or First Orion Blog .

title: UI Engineering Intern - Flurry
requirements:
It takes powerful technology to connect our brands and partners with an audience of 1 billion. Nearly half of Verizon Media employees are building the code and platforms that help us achieve that. Whether you’re looking to write mobile app code, engineer the servers behind our massive ad tech stacks, or develop algorithms to help us process 4 trillion data points a day, what you do here will have a huge impact on our business—and the world. Want in? As Verizon’s media unit, our brands like Yahoo, TechCrunch and more help people stay informed and entertained, communicate and transact, while creating new ways for advertisers and partners to connect. With technologies like XR, AI, machine-learning, and 5G, we’re transforming media for tomorrow, too. We're creators and coders, dreamers and doers creating what's next in content, advertising and technology.

This internship position will be fully remote. Since location is not relevant, you can be based from anywhere domestically in the U.S. during your internship.

A Little About The Team

Verizon Media brands comprise some of the premier destinations on the Internet. This means that we engineer massively scalable, widely distributed, highly performant, and efficient software systems.

Verizon Media’s Flurry platform is a premier mobile analytics provider used by mobile application developers worldwide. Flurry helps iOS and Android app developers acquire, understand, retain, and monetize their audiences. The team Flurry runs one of the biggest data clusters and as such we are responsible, to our users - mobile app developers, for providing fast, clean, and relevant data as well as key measurements and insights about their app’s usage.

We Value

We work in a deeply collaborative and highly efficient manner to allow engineers of any level to make deep, meaningful impact to the product and the business. We are a multidisciplinary team passionate about creating new products, we thrive on innovation and lead by example.
Inclusivity, open-mindedness, and diversity
Creative thinkers and innovators
Self-motivation and drive
Taking care of ourselves and each other
Empowering people and providing a forum to voice their ideas
These values are the core of how we think, work, and interact on a day-to-day basis. We are developing next generation technologies to help app developers understand usage of their apps through complex, scalable data platforms, with ever growing and interesting challenges.

We're looking for a creative, self-motivated, driven engineering intern to join our UI team.

A Lot About You

As a skilled and passionate UI engineer, you are working with a strong, cross-functional, and cross-geography team of engineers to design and develop applications that encapsulate our mobile analytics solution comprising of data collection, large scale data manipulation, long term data storage and low-latency retrieval, reporting, and analytical systems.

You are skilled with HTML and CSS and you are a JavaScript expert proficient in modern frameworks such as React. You are committed to building tested, high quality, and secure applications. You have an understanding of API technologies that back your web applications, and have an understanding of how to build them to scale.

Your day
Fully immersed with the team, participate in all team's daily, weekly activities
Collaborate with current team members to build effective, robust solutions
Work alongside our UI engineers to port our existing code to storybook.js to help us align with other neighbouring UI teams
Perform infrastructure work to bring us up to webpack, and get our functional tests off from selenium to cyprus.io
Support our applications in production; including working with our Support, Operations and Product teams to minimize the incident impact on our business
Work closely with the UX team to plan and provide feedback for innovative new designs and feature ideas.
Collect and analyze system performance and metrics and tune application performance to meet aggressive SLAs.

Requirements
You have a passion for your work, the technologies you build, and the people with whom you work.
You are adept with HTML, CSS, multiple JavaScript libraries, and front-end framework React
You are familiar with JavaScript development tools (NPM, Gulp, Grunt, Webpack, etc)
You are familiar with profiling and debugging complex next-generation single page web applications
You have strong analytical and problem-solving skills
You are familiar with NodeJS
Experience with Agile product development methodology desirable but not required

Verizon Media is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to, and will not be discriminated against based on age, race, gender, color, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, disability or any other protected category. Verizon Media is dedicated to providing an accessible environment for all candidates during the application process and for employees during their employment. title: Summer 2021 Internships: UX/UI Design Research Intern
requirements:
Description

Want to spend your summer interning at a company that is consistently rated as one of the best places to work in the country? Is this a rhetorical question??

The Motley Fool is a multimedia financial services company that provides financial solutions for investors through various stock, investing, and personal finance services. We've been on the block for about 26 years and have honed a reputation for producing industry-leading work in a nationally recognized workplace. Our mission is to help the world become happier, smarter, and richer and the backbone supporting this global mission is our top-notch tech team. If you dream of becoming a brilliant and skilled web designer and are ready to work hard on cutting edge technologies alongside awesome coworkers, then step up to the plate, and tell us why you should land a spot among our Foolish ranks.

For eight Foolish weeks as a UX/UI Design Research Intern, you'll be embedded with the Design and Web Technologies teams that support, build, and maintain our Foolish products and websites. You will have hands-on experience working with users and internal teams to investigate existing user mental models and design products that sustainably address our end users' needs. You will gain exposure to the entire UX Design process -- from the initial research to design, design testing, as well as the hand off to development! You'll also collaboratively shape what success looks like for the changes you propose. The projects you could work on may be team-level or span our entire tech organization.

You'll be challenged and mentored by some of our greatest designers all summer, and in turn, you'll develop the skills it takes to cultivate a user first mindset that will set you apart from your peers. We're excited to open our doors for Summer 2021 Design Intern applicants, so send us your most Foolishly written cover letter and your ultra-impressive resume. We're prepared to be wowed!

What You Need To Succeed
Excellent problem-solving skills with the ability to analyze situations, identify existing or potential opportunities, and recommend solutions.
Ability to present complex qualitative and quantitative data to diverse audiences in an understandable format via excellent verbal and written and/or visual communication skills.
Flexibility and ability to learn quickly.
Extraordinary critical thinking skills.
High-performing problem solving and collaborative skills.
Ability to communicate clearly and demonstrate emotional intelligence.
Ability to think quickly, resolve problems, and multi-task across numerous projects and teams.
Ability to keep a calm and pleasant demeanor under tight, evolving, and sometimes unpredictable timeframes and priorities.
Ability to translate insights into workable prototypes for testing and future iteration.

What would be really cool of you to have, but not required:
Experience applying qualitative research methods.
Experience with full-life cycle research and inspection methods which occur from ethnography all the way to statistically-based user testing.
Experience working on enterprise-level experiences that span multiple channels such as web, mobile, and offline interactions.
Experience with quantitative, behavioral analysis, and statistical concepts.
Experience managing digital product analytics with tools such as Google Analytics, Tableau, Airtable, or Spaghetti and Meatballs.
Experience using design methods and user research data to influence business strategy and leadership.

title: UI/UX Intern - Pittsburgh
requirements:
About Treatspace

Treatspace is a SaaS-based healthcare platform that is disrupting and improving every day, critical healthcare processes that no longer work in a rapidly changing regulatory and reimbursement landscape. Our innovations help practices solve patient access and acquisition challenges. Treatspace received the Global Action Challenge Award in Nashville, Tennessee in 2015, competing against hundreds of other healthcare companies nationally and is one of the Top 5 Startups named by the Pittsburgh Technology Council Tech 50 Awards. We have also raised several million dollars of venture capital fund

How You Will Contribute

You will be working closely with the engineering and product development team to own the product design lifecycle from end to end. You will begin by gaining a deep understanding of our users through research and behavior analysis. As a fast-growing company, we are constantly building new products, features, and tools that require forward-thinking designers to help us remain industry leaders. You will work to create wireframes, beautiful icons, and layouts for desktop and mobile responsive sites.

Skills You’ll Bring
Experience or interest designing and shipping web-based products and interfaces
Strong experience working from flows and wireframes through to the final product
UX and UI experience
Experience working with a SaaS product
Designing wireframes and mock-ups of new features
Collaborating with team members during design reviews to refine the user experience
Working with software engineers to ensure consistency between design and implementation.
Propose solutions to solve design/user experience challenges
Writing clean, concise and descriptive documentation of your features

Why You're Important To Us

This role will impact our organization by creating beautiful designs for our products while continually improving our overall aesthetic. You will work in a fast-paced environment where continuous innovation is the bar and high attention to detail is a must have. The ability to manage multiple, competing priorities simultaneously will be the key to success in this role.

What You'll Need
Currently enrolled in or recently graduated from a Bachelor's Degree
Knowledge of UI/UX best practices and trends
Portfolio of UI/UX related work

title: UI JavaScript Intern

Our Company

Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen.

We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!

UI JavaScript Intern

Adobe is looking for a UI JavaScript Intern in the Adobe Experience Platform. Working with Data Engineers & Architects, Software Engineers, Marketers, Product Managers and the Adobe Experience Design team you will be creating brand new user experiences and components for our core personas: Marketers, Data Scientists, Data Engineers, Data Architects and Technical Analysts.

What you’ll do

title: Research Intern, Neuromotor Interfaces (PhD)
requirements:
Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.

Facebook Reality Labs is looking for interns to advance our pioneering work in neuromotor interfaces , which has grown out of the acquisition of CTRL-labs. This technology could become one of the main pillars for interaction with the virtual and augmented world. Help us unleash human potential by erasing the bottlenecks between user intent and action. In this role you will embed with a world-class, multi-disciplinary team of researchers to investigate the nature of human neuromotor signals (EMG), develop novel signal processing and machine learning methods to infer a user’s intent, and create novel interaction techniques and user experiences.Our internships are twelve (12) to twenty four (24) weeks long, and we have various start dates throughout the year.

Responsibilities
Plan and execute cutting-edge applied research to advance neuromotor interface capabilities.
Collaborate with engineering and Human-Computer Interactions (HCI) teams to translate fundamental scientific knowledge into new technology and user experiences.
Use quantitative research methods to define, iterate upon and advance key areas of our research agenda.
Minimum Qualification
Must obtain work authorization in the country of employment at the time of hire and maintain ongoing work authorization during employment.
Currently has, or is in the process of obtaining a PhD, in [one or more of the following fields:] systems neuroscience, computational neuroscience, machine learning, biophysics, physics, electrical engineering, computer science, statistics, or related fields.
Strong research-oriented implementation skills, including fluency in scientific Python and PyTorch.
Interpersonal experience: cross-group and cross-culture collaboration

Preferred Qualification
Intent to return to degree-program after the completion of the internship.
Familiarity with scientific communication tools (jupyter, matplotlib).
Experience in software engineering in industry.
Experience in signal processing and familiarity with real-time signals.
Experience working with neural data or other physiological signals.

We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. Facebook is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a disability, please let us know at accommodations-ext@fb.com.

title: Software Engineering User Interface (UI) Intern
requirements:
Company Overview

KLA is a global leader in diversified electronics for the semiconductor manufacturing ecosystem. Virtually every electronic device in the world is produced using our technologies. No laptop, smartphone, wearable device, voice-controlled gadget, flexible screen, VR device or smart car would have made it into your hands without us. KLA invents systems and solutions for the manufacturing of wafers and reticles, integrated circuits, packaging, printed circuit boards and flat panel displays. The innovative ideas and devices that are advancing humanity all begin with inspiration, research and development. KLA focuses more than average on innovation and in 2019 we invested 15% of sales back into R&D. Our expert teams of physicists, engineers, data scientists and problem-solvers work together with the world’s leading technology providers to accelerate the delivery of tomorrow’s electronic devices. Life here is exciting and our teams thrive on tackling really hard problems. There is never a dull moment with us.
Group/Division
The Global Service Support Organization (GSS) team headquartered in Milpitas, CA is our service organization that consists of Service Sales and Marketing, Spares Supply Chain management, Field Operations, Engineering, Product Training, and Technical Support. The GSS organization partners with our field teams and customers in all business sectors to maintain the high performance and productivity of our products through a flexible portfolio of services. Our comprehensive services include: proactive management of tools to identify and improve performance; expertise in optics, image processing and motion control with worldwide service engineers, 24/7 technical support teams and knowledge management systems; and an extensive parts network to ensure worldwide availability of parts.
The Global Service Support Organization (GSS) team headquartered in Milpitas, CA is our service organization that consists of Service Sales and Marketing, Spares Supply Chain management, Field Operations, Engineering, Product Training, and Technical Support. The GSS organization partners with our field teams and customers in all business sectors to maintain the high performance and productivity of our products through a flexible portfolio of services. Our comprehensive services include: proactive management of tools to identify and improve performance; expertise in optics, image processing and motion control with worldwide service engineers, 24/7 technical support teams and knowledge management systems; and an extensive parts network to ensure worldwide availability of parts.

The GSS organization's Engineering group develops data systems for improved diagnostics and predictive maintenance. The data systems monitor the performance of fleets of KLA test and measurement equipment in semiconductor fabrication plant environments. They collect, transform, and store data. They provide visualizations, recommendations based on analytics, and alerts. This exciting position will enable you to interact with a wide variety of engineers and KLA system data.

Responsibilities

Do you love learning and using new technologies? Do you have a passion for coding, data exploration, and UI design? Are you looking for a role where you can work on open-ended problems with small collaborative teams?

As a UI engineering intern, you will work directly with our team of software and algorithm engineers on the design and development of web applications using real-time data visualization tools. Develop User Interfaces that help our engineers to more effectively troubleshoot and optimize KLA semiconductor inspection and metrology equipment. Help improve our existing visualization tools using new, emerging technologies. Learn how to translate user needs to design and software requirements. In conjunction with a mentor, improve your programming skills and learn software development techniques!

Desired Qualifications
Interest in and ability to learn software technology and KLA domain knowledge
Experience with/knowledge of web programming languages such as HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and libraries/frameworks such as React, Redux, Angular, Vue, etc
Familiarity with a programming language commonly used for data science such as Python or R
Familiarity with third party visualization libraries such as Plotly, Bokeh, or D3.js
Experience/familiarity with REST interfaces
Familiarity with User/Human Centered Design, and interest in working with users to understand their needs and building interfaces to meet them
Required qualifications:
Scheduled graduation by June 2022

Bachelors level coursework in Computer Science, Data Science, or equivalent

Academic and/or internship programming experience in one or more languages such as JavaScript, Python, C#, C/C++, Java, etc.

Strong communication skills

Minimum Qualifications

Some College or work experience of 0 years

We offer a competitive, family friendly total rewards package. We design our programs to reflect our commitment to an inclusive environment, while ensuring we provide benefits that meet the diverse needs of our employees.

KLA is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status or any other status protected by applicable law. We will ensure that qualified individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us at talent.acquisition@kla.com to request accommodation.

title: Summer 2021 Internships: UX/UI Design Research Intern
requirements:
Description

Want to spend your summer interning at a company that is consistently rated as one of the best places to work in the country? Is this a rhetorical question??

The Motley Fool is a multimedia financial services company that provides financial solutions for investors through various stock, investing, and personal finance services. We've been on the block for about 26 years and have honed a reputation for producing industry-leading work in a nationally recognized workplace. Our mission is to help the world become happier, smarter, and richer and the backbone supporting this global mission is our top-notch tech team. If you dream of becoming a brilliant and skilled web designer and are ready to work hard on cutting edge technologies alongside awesome coworkers, then step up to the plate, and tell us why you should land a spot among our Foolish ranks.

For eight Foolish weeks as a UX/UI Design Research Intern, you'll be embedded with the Design and Web Technologies teams that support, build, and maintain our Foolish products and websites. You will have hands-on experience working with users and internal teams to investigate existing user mental models and design products that sustainably address our end users' needs. You will gain exposure to the entire UX Design process -- from the initial research to design, design testing, as well as the hand off to development! You'll also collaboratively shape what success looks like for the changes you propose. The projects you could work on may be team-level or span our entire tech organization.

You'll be challenged and mentored by some of our greatest designers all summer, and in turn, you'll develop the skills it takes to cultivate a user first mindset that will set you apart from your peers. We're excited to open our doors for Summer 2021 Design Intern applicants, so send us your most Foolishly written cover letter and your ultra-impressive resume. We're prepared to be wowed!

What You Need To Succeed
Excellent problem-solving skills with the ability to analyze situations, identify existing or potential opportunities, and recommend solutions.
Ability to present complex qualitative and quantitative data to diverse audiences in an understandable format via excellent verbal and written and/or visual communication skills.
Flexibility and ability to learn quickly.
Extraordinary critical thinking skills.
High-performing problem solving and collaborative skills.
Ability to communicate clearly and demonstrate emotional intelligence.
Ability to think quickly, resolve problems, and multi-task across numerous projects and teams.
Ability to keep a calm and pleasant demeanor under tight, evolving, and sometimes unpredictable timeframes and priorities.
Ability to translate insights into workable prototypes for testing and future iteration.

What would be really cool of you to have, but not required:
Experience applying qualitative research methods.
Experience with full-life cycle research and inspection methods which occur from ethnography all the way to statistically-based user testing.
Experience working on enterprise-level experiences that span multiple channels such as web, mobile, and offline interactions.
Experience with quantitative, behavioral analysis, and statistical concepts.
Experience managing digital product analytics with tools such as Google Analytics, Tableau, Airtable, or Spaghetti and Meatballs.
Experience using design methods and user research data to influence business strategy and leadership.
Familiarity with basic concepts of investing and finance.
